certificates.name: Machine learning in Python with scikit-learn

projects.name: PVC Duct Cutting Machine Computer Vision System
projects.summary: This project used computer vision technology to identify clipping points within PVC ducts, focusing on detecting their flat areas for accurate cuts. Adaptable to ambient noise, the system ensured consistent performance, while its lightweight design enabled seamless integration with the machine's high-speed operations. Utilizing a Raspberry Pi, this compact yet powerful computing platform was used to drive the entire system.

projects.name: Remote Controller for a Silage Block Cutting Machine
projects.summary: Due to operator injuries, while cutting stacked up silage blocks, a remote controlling system was developed and configured so that the operators be able to control the machine using wireless technology. The device was able to fully control the machine. The developed device controlled the system by manipulating the pneumatic and hydraulic valves of the machine using a TCP/UDP local network with an android application. Which in fact, the machine performs with more precision and offers product and safety measures. Android application developed by Eng. Ali Khalili Based on React-native.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'
